skill.name: iac-checkov
skill.description: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) security scanning using Checkov with 750+ built-in policies for Terraform, CloudFormation, Kubernetes, Dockerfile, and ARM templates. Use when: (1) Scanning IaC files for security misconfigurations and compliance violations, (2) Validating cloud infrastructure against CIS, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and SOC2 benchmarks, (3) Detecting secrets and hardcoded credentials in IaC, (4) Implementing policy-as-code in CI/CD pipelines, (5) Generating compliance reports with remediation guidance for cloud security posture management.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Provides configuration templates and CI/CD workflows for Checkov, an open-source IaC security scanner. No scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond configuration files.

content.user_title: Scan Infrastructure as Code for Security
content.value_statement: Manual review of Terraform, Kubernetes, and CloudFormation files misses critical misconfigurations. This skill integrates Checkov to automatically scan IaC for 750+ security policies, detecting encryption gaps, overly permissive access, and compliance violations before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Scan Terraform files for AWS, Azure, and GCP misconfigurations
Analyze Kubernetes manifests for pod security violations
Detect hardcoded secrets and credentials in IaC files
Generate compliance reports mapped to CIS, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and SOC2
Create custom security policies for organization requirements
Integrate scanning into GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and pre-commit hooks
limitations: Does not fix issues automatically - requires manual remediation
Scans static IaC files only, not live cloud infrastructure
Does not scan Terraform state files or plan outputs

use_cases.title: CI/CD Security Gates
use_cases.description: Block deployments with CRITICAL or HIGH severity issues by integrating Checkov scans into GitHub Actions or GitLab CI pipelines.

use_cases.title: Compliance Mapping
use_cases.description: Generate reports mapping IaC findings to CIS, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, and SOC2 requirements for audit preparation.

use_cases.title: Custom Policy Enforcement
use_cases.description: Define organization-specific security policies that extend beyond built-in checks to enforce naming conventions and tagging requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Terraform Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Checkov to scan my Terraform files in the infrastructure/ directory. Show all HIGH and CRITICAL findings with file paths, line numbers, and remediation guidance.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes Security
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan Kubernetes manifests in the k8s/ directory using Checkov. Focus on pod security standards, privilege escalation risks, and container security context issues.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a Checkov compliance scan against CIS AWS Foundations benchmark. Generate a JSON report and summarize which controls are passing and failing.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me write a custom Checkov policy in Python that ensures all S3 buckets have encryption enabled and are blocked from public access. Include the check logic and how to load it.

output_examples.input: Scan my Terraform files for security issues
output: CRITICAL: S3 bucket allows public access (CKV_AWS_93)
Issue: BlockPublicAcls is set to false
Fix: Set block_public_acls = true in PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
HIGH: Security group allows 0.0.0.0/0 on port 22 (CKV_AWS_23)
Issue: Ingress rule permits SSH from any IP
"Fix: Restrict cidr_blocks to corporate VPN range

best_practices: Run Checkov on every PR that modifies IaC files to catch issues early
Start with --soft-fail mode to build team awareness before enforcing gates
Use baseline files to track remediation progress without blocking on existing debt
Document legitimate suppressions with ticket numbers and business justification
anti_patterns: Using blanket suppressions (skip-check: "*") instead of targeting specific resources
Skipping all LOW severity findings without reviewing them for context
Running scans only in production pipelines instead of developer workflows
Ignoring false positives instead of tuning policies or adding suppressions

faq.question: Does Checkov scan Terraform state files?
faq.answer: No, Checkov scans .tf files and configuration. Use tfsec or Trivy for state file and plan analysis.

faq.question: Which cloud providers are supported?
faq.answer: AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI, Alibaba Cloud, and Kubernetes. Terraform, CloudFormation, ARM, and Docker support.

faq.question: How to integrate with existing CI/CD?
faq.answer: Use the bridgecrewio/checkov-action for GitHub Actions or the Docker image for GitLab CI, Jenkins, and Azure DevOps.

faq.question: Are credentials required to scan IaC?
faq.answer: No, Checkov performs static analysis. Cloud provider credentials are only needed for module downloads.

faq.question: Why am I seeing false positives?
faq.answer: Add inline suppressions with justifications. Update to latest Checkov version which improves accuracy.

faq.question: How does this compare to tfsec or Terrascan?
faq.answer: Checkov has more policies and better multi-cloud support. It uses graph-based analysis to understand resource relationships.
